meanings.definition: Walkyries: mythical female figures in Norse mythology who choose those who may die in battle and those who may live
meanings.sent1: In Norse mythology, the walkyries decide the fate of warriors in battle.
meanings.sent2: The walkyries were believed to have the power to determine the outcome of a fierce fight.
meanings.sent3: The walkyries must have a tough job deciding who wins and who loses in battles.
meanings.sent4: The walkyries' role as fate deciders is similar to judges in a courtroom.
meanings.sent5: Legends describe the walkyries as mysterious beings with the power to influence battles.

meanings.definition: Walkyries: a group of female warriors in Norse mythology who ride through the air and lead the souls of dead warriors to Valhalla
meanings.sent1: The walkyries soar through the sky, guiding fallen warriors to Valhalla.
meanings.sent2: Legends speak of the walkyries as fearless fighters who protect the fallen in battle.
meanings.sent3: Imagine the walkyries flying through the clouds, escorting fallen heroes to their resting place.
meanings.sent4: The walkyries' flight to Valhalla symbolizes the journey of the soul after death.
meanings.sent5: The image of the walkyries riding through the air is etched in Norse folklore.
